coded_answer.p: Dear Sir/Madam
My name is Alida Fanetti, and I'm writing to you about the musical show which I saw during my stay in London recently.
One evening, while I was walking around the city, I saw a very interesting advertisement, which was about a musical show.

I'm a funfan of Danny Brook so when I read in the advertisement his namehis name in the advertisement I immediately decided to go to the show. The tickets were a little expensive but I was with otheranother TEN people, so when we read "Discounts Available" we expected that the theatre had organised a special discount for groupgroups of numerous people.

It wasn't true; there weren't any discounts. The show started at 20.15 and not at 19.30 so we waitingwere waiting for a long time. Before the show started, a man said that there wasn't Danny BrookDanny Brook wasn't there because he was ill. It was a disaster.

After the show, which wasn't as good as we expected, we decided to go to the theatre restaurant. It was closed because people in the kitchen weren't ready with the food. It wasn't a "perfect evening out" like you said in the advertisement, so my friends and I, would be gratefullgrateful if you willwould give us some money back, if itthat is possible.
I hope to receive an answer.
Your faightfullyfaithfully
